solution_line_template: First find the total distance Carson walks along the warehouse's long sides: {warehouse_length} feet/side * {num_long_sides} sides = <<{warehouse_length}*{num_long_sides}={distance_long_sides}>>{distance_long_sides} feet

Then find the total distance Carson walks along the warehouse's short sides: {warehouse_width} feet/side * {num_short_sides} sides = <<{warehouse_width}*{num_short_sides}={distance_short_sides}>>{distance_short_sides} feet

Add those two amounts to find the total distance walk in one circle: {distance_long_sides} feet + {distance_short_sides} feet = <<{distance_long_sides}+{distance_short_sides}={distance_one_circle}>>{distance_one_circle} feet
Then find the number of circles Carson actually walks: {planned_circles} circles - {skipped_circles} circles = <<{planned_circles}-{skipped_circles}={actual_circles}>>{actual_circles} circles

Then multiply the distance of one circle by the number of circles Carson makes: {distance_one_circle} feet/circle * {actual_circles} circles = <<{distance_one_circle}*{actual_circles}={total_distance_walked}>>{total_distance_walked} feet
